page.title: 02GEOGRAPHY OF THE FEN EDGE
page.content: The area covered forms part of the Fen Edge between the East Anglian Heights and the southern edge of the Cambridgeshire Fens. The underlying soil is chalk with some glacial gravels in the south-east The region has been formed into gently rounded hills which dip from 61 metres in the south-east to 15 metres in the north-west. There is only one waterway - a small stream which rises from a spring at Spring Hall and flows north-west for five miles to join the River Cam. There is a windmill in the south-east - a feature typical of this area.
